did.head: Records Summary
did.abstract: The Belton Brick Manufacturing Company records document the company from incorporation in 1883 until 1889. The collection includes stock certificates, legal documents, company minutes, and financial ledgers and daybooks.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Belton Brick Manufacturing Company was established in 1883 April, in Belton, Texas. Judge O. T. Tyler, George W. Tyler, and George J. Butler incorporated the company with $20,000 of capital stock. W. F. Beamer, also a shareholder, leased the brick yard yearly. The yard was located two miles east of the Bell County Courthouse, near the Leon River, and connected on a switch track to the Missouri Pacific Railroad. The location near the river, as well as clay and sand, allowed the company to produce straw-colored bricks, which became well known in the region.
Records for the Belton Brick Manufacturing Company are unclear on end date of operations. However, W. F. Beamer operated at least one additional brick company in the area after Belton Brick.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Belton Brick Manufacturing Company records document a short period of operations from 1883 to 1889. Items present indicate that operations of an existing company were transferred to Belton Brick Manufacturing at the time of incorporation. This is possible as outside sources show that Belton Brick Stockholder, W. F. Beamer, was also involved with other brick companies, including the Bell County Brick Company which was also located in Belton, Texas.

The Administrative series provides insight into company incorporation as well as stockholder’s meetings through several contracts, stock certificates, and a minute book. The Financial series illustrates daily operations with account books and ledgers. These are also helpful as they provide documentation of companies and persons utilizing the bricks.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: An unpublished finding aid was present for this collection. This was used as the basis for current arrangement, with slight adjustments. The collection is now arranged in two series; Series I: Administrative, and Series II: Financial.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Administrative Series, dated 1883-1889, includes original stock certificates, contracts, and minute book for the company. The series is arranged in chronological order and in good condition.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Financial series, dated 1883-1886, includes ledgers, day books, and account books. The series is arranged in chronological order and in good condition.
